thread.title: Delaware's first major snowfall since 2022 arrives, ending drought
thread.title_full: Delaware's first major snowfall since 2022 arrives, ending drought

author: - Unlimited Digital Access
title: Delaware's first major snowfall since 2022 arrives, ending drought
text: LOCALDelaware's first major snowfall since 2022 finally arrives, ending droughtTim Sheridan, General Manager, removes snow from the windshield of a car at his Kirkwood Highway Sheridan Ford dealership after a snowstorm dropped close to 3 inches since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalTim Sheridan, General Manager, spends the morning removing snow from the cars at his Kirkwood Highway Sheridan Ford dealership after a snowstorm dropped close to 3 inches since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalDrivers maneuver a messy commute along Kirkwood Highway after a snowstorm dropped close to 3 inches since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers, Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalSeveral inches of snow blanket a backyard in Talleyville on Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2024.Isabel Hughes/Delaware News JournalGoose, a cat born in the summer of 2023, experiences snow for the first time on Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2024. She's undecided.Isabel Hughes/Delaware News JournalCars sit covered in snow in a parking lot at the intersection of Dunlinden Drive and Kirkwood Highway after a snowstorm dropped close to 3 inches since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalCars sit covered in snow near Buckley Mill Road after a snowstorm dropped close to 3 inches since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalThis is nuts. A squirrel on Tuesday morning plays in the snow and looks for food at a yard in Westgate Farms near Hockessin. Some roads in the area have been plowed. 1/16/2024Patricia Talorico, Delaware News JournalOzzie the dog isn't sure what to make of the snow on the ground Tuesday morning in Westgate Farms near Hockessin. The area got more than 2 inches of snow overnight. 1/16/2024Patricia Talorico, Delaware News JournalTim Sheridan, General Manager, removes snow from a car roof at his Kirkwood Highway Sheridan Ford dealership after a snowstorm dropped close to 3 inches since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalChildren practice sledding in the near 3 inches of snow dropped in Rockwood Park since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalChildren practice sledding in the near 3 inches of snow dropped in Rockwood Park since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers, Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalA mother and her daughter practice sledding in the near 3 inches of snow dropped in Rockwood Park since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers, Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalChildren practice sledding in the near 3 inches of snow dropped in Rockwood Park since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers, Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalChildren practice sledding in the near 3 inches of snow dropped in Rockwood Park since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers, Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalVisitors practice sledding in the near 3 inches of snow dropped in Rockwood Park since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News JournalJoules fetches a frisbee for her owner Luisa Sawyer, not pictured, at Rockwood Park in the near 3 inches of snow dropped since yesterday in Wilmington, Tuesday, Jan. 16, 2023.Benjamin Chambers, Benjamin Chambers/Delaware News Journal
